resources.string: Take a photo of the meter screen displaying the measurement result
Enter the measured value
Press briefly (*sd_on_off*) to turn device on.

Remove protective cap, rinse the electrode with distilled water and immerse the instrument into the sample so that the instrument is submersed to the sealing ring level. Stir the sensor gently while it is in the sample. Press briefly (*sd_on_off*) to freeze / unfreeze the measurement.
Take a photo of the screen with the measurement and fill in the measurement value.
Press and hold (*sd_on_off*) (3 sec.) to turn the instrument off.
Rinse the sensor with distilled water (never touch the electrode with anything) and place the protective cap back. Make sure the protective cap is filled with KCL solution.

Always store the electrode in the protective cap with KCL solution. Regularly check the calibration of the device and recalibrate if necessary. For calibration instructions: see the product manual in the box.
Connect the turbidity tubes and fill the tube with the water sample until you cannot see the black circle at the yellow bottom anymore.
Empty the tube with small intervals until you can see the black circle at the yellow bottom again and read out the turbidity on the side of the tube.
Fill in the obtained turbidity value in the app.
Empty the tube completely, clean if necessary, disconnect tubes and store them.

Remove protective cap, rinse the sensor with the sample water and immerse the instrument into the sample so that the instrument is submersed to the sealing ring level. Press briefly (*sd_on_off*) to freeze / unfreeze the measurement.
Rinse the sensor with distilled water (never touch the electrode with anything) and place the protective cap back.
Regularly check the calibration of the device and recalibrate if necessary. For calibration instructions: see the product manual in the box.
Open the lid of the tester.
Rinse the compartments with the water sample. Next, fill the three compartments until the edge with the water sample. Avoid touching the water sample or the inside of the tester.
Add the Phenol Red tablet reagent directly from the foil into the left compartment (pH Phenol Red). Avoid touching the reagent tablets.
Add the DPD No.1 tablet directly from the foil into the right (Cl DPD) compartment. Avoid touching the reagent tablets.
Close the box with the lid and shake until the reagents are dissolved. Be sure to place the lid correctly with the arrow facing you.

Find out which colour of the pH or free chlorine interval best matches with your sample and tap both colour intervals in the test in the Caddisfly app. Next, clean the compartments with distilled water.
Select colour intervals
Select the colour intervals before continuing
Select the intervals that match the water sample colours in the box.
The Checkit Comparator uses two cells and a coloured disc.
Fill both cells to the 10 ml mark
Close one cell with a lid and place it in the left-hand space of the comparator. It acts as a blank.
Add one tablet to the other cell, and close it with a lid. Swirl the cell until the tablet has dissolved
Place the second cell in the right-hand space of the comparator.
Insert the coloured disk in the comparator.
By rotating the disk, match the two colours against daylight, looking AWAY from the sun.
Read of the result and record the number.
